document.masterDocTitle: Madoxychara gen. nov. (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha: Flatidae), a new genus of the tribe Phantiini Melichar from Madagascar

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Madoxychara gen. nov. (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha: Flatidae), a new genus of the tribe Phantiini Melichar from Madagascar

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Madoxychara unicornis
sp. nov. , here designated.

Etymology . The generic name is a combination of two words: Madagascar and
Paroxychara
, the African flatid genus which is closely related to
Madoxychara
gen. nov. Gender: feminine.

Diagnosis .
Madoxychara
gen. nov. is externally similar to genus
Paroxychara
Lallemand et Synave, 1952
but differs by the following genital characters: male—anal tube elongated and ‘broken’ at midlength, basal part of periandrium with 3 narrow and elongated dorsal processes oriented apicad, aedeagus single (not symmetrical) (
Paroxychara
—anal tube short and widened, basal part of periandrium without processes, aedeagus symmetrical); female—posterior margin of gonoplac with single tooth, base of gonapophysis VIII with narrow and long appendage (
Paroxychara
—posterior margin of gonoplac with 6 teeth, base of gonapophysis VIII without appendage).
Description . Body slender. Head strongly prolonged, with compound eyes in dorsal view distinctly narrower than thorax ( Figs 1, 3 , 5, 6 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–4.
Madoxychara unicornis
sp. nov.
, male. (1) habitus, dorsal view; (2) same, lateral view; (3) anterior part of body, dorsal view; (4) same, frontal view.

FIGURES 5–10.
Madoxychara unicornis
sp. nov.
, male. (5) habitus, lateral view; (6) same, dorsal view; (7) anterior part of body, dorsal view; (8) vertex, dorsal view; (9) pronotum and mesonotum, dorsal view; (10) anterior part of body, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Hind wings distinctly shorter than tegmina, reaching about half of abdomen, transverse veinlets absent.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 11–16.
Madoxychara unicornis
sp. nov.
, male. (11–12) frons and clypeus, frontal view (13) antenna, general view; (14) same, anterodorsal view; (15–16) antennal plate organs.

FIGURES 17–22.
Madoxychara unicornis
sp. nov.
, male. (17) basal part of tegmen, lateral view; (18) same, apical part; (19) same, basal part; (20) apex of hind tibia and tarsomeres, dorsal view; (21) same, lateral view; (22) basitarsomere, dorso-lateral view.

FIGURES 23–28.
Madoxychara unicornis
sp. nov.
(23–24) male abdomen and genital capsule, lateral view; (25) same, dorsal view; (26) same, frontal view; (27–28) female abdomen and genital capsule, lateral view.

FIGURES 29–34.
Madoxychara unicornis
sp. nov.
, female. (29) female genital capsule, frontal view; (30) gonoplacs, frontal view; (31–34) female genital capsule, ventral view.

FIGURES 35–42.
Madoxychara unicornis
sp. nov.
, male. (35) stylus, lateral view; (36) periandrium, lateral view; (37) periandrium, upper part, dorsal view; (38) periandrium, ventrolateral view (specimen from Zombitse); (39) periandrium, upper part, dorsolateral view (specimen from Zombitse); (40) periandrium, lower part, dorsal view; (41) aedeagus, dorsal view; (41) same, lateral view.

FIGURES 43–49.
Madoxychara unicornis
sp. nov.
, female. (43) pregenital sternite, flattened; (44) anal tube, lateral view; (45) same, dorsal view; (46) gonoplac, external side; (47) gonaphophysis VIII, external side; (48) gonapophyses IX and gonospiculum bridge, lateral view; (49) same, dorsal view.

FIGURES 50–51.
Madoxychara unicornis
sp. nov.
, female. (50) bursa copulatrix, lateral view; (51) spermatheca.
